entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. entry.title: Aerosoft Releases Baden for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Aerosoft has just released their newest scenery Karlsruhe/Baden-Baden airport for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. Known as the international airport for Karlsruhe, Baden is a focus airport for Ryanair which operates routes over the majority of Spain and some other destinations within Europe. The airport was initially a military aerodrome in 1951 and then closed in 1994 to be turned into a regional airport as well as a business park. In 2001, the first commercial flights took place to destinations Ibiza and Palma De Mallorca by a former airline, Hapag-Lloyd Flug (now TUI fly Deutschland.) entry.title: Microsoft Releases 40th Anniversary Edition Update for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Microsoft has just released the long-awaited 40th Anniversary Edition update (SU11) for Microsoft Flight Simulator, bringing twelve new aircraft, four classic commercial airports, fourteen heliports and twenty-four classic missions. It is the most substantial update to date in terms of new content. âThe aircraft list includes seven classics (1903 Wright Flyer, 1915 Curtiss JN-4 Jenny, 1927 Ryan NYP Spirit of St. Louis, 1935 Douglas DC-3, 1937 Grumman G-21 Goose, 1947 Havilland DHC-2 Beaver, 1947 Hughes H-4 Hercules), two helicopters (Guimbal Cabri G2, Bell 407), two sailplanes/gliders (DG Aviation LS8-18, DG-1001E neo) and a true-to-life airliner (A310-300). âAirport-wise, we have the addition of Hong Kong Kai Tak, Chicago Meigs Field, Princess Juliana International (St. Maarten), and First Flight Airport in Kitty Hawk. The update also includes VRAM management improvements to the DX12 version, along with the addition of AMD FSR2 and Nvidia DLSS 3 (including frame generator). â The complete feature list follows down below: 7 classic aircraft: 2 sailplanes/gliders: 1 true-to-life airliner: 4 iconic airports: 24 classic activities from previous Flight Simulator titles: 7 new tutorial missions for Gliders: New features The new update is available right now on the Microsoft Store and Steam, requiring at least 41 GB of free disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: UK2000 Releases Telluride Regional Airport for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. UK2000 Scenery has just released their rendition of Telluride Regional Airport (KTEX) for Microsoft Flight Simulator, the highest commercial airport in the United States, and the second highest overall in the country, only behind Leadville Airport. The yearly passenger figures are around 17.000, with Denver being the most popular destination in terms of sheer volume.Â The airport is famous for providing a challenging approach because of the surrounding geography, runway length, and steep glide path angle (3.55 on 9 and 4.0 on 27).
